briefdescription.para: Object that maps the surface's border to 2D space
Traits object to access a sparse linear system

memberdef.argsstring: (const Triangle_mesh &mesh, halfedge_descriptor bhd, const VertexUVMap uvmap) const
memberdef.name: is_one_to_one_mapping

briefdescription.para: returns whether the 3D -> 2D mapping is one-to-one.

memberdef.argsstring: (Triangle_mesh &mesh, halfedge_descriptor bhd, VertexUVmap uvmap, VertexIndexMap vimap, VertexParameterizedMap vpmap)
memberdef.name: parameterize

briefdescription.para: computes a one-to-one mapping from a triangular 3D surface mesh to a piece of the 2D space.

detaileddescription.para: The mapping is piecewise linear (linear in each triangle). The result is the (u,v) pair image of each vertex of the 3D surface.

parameterdescription.para: must be a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<Triangle_mesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and Point_2 (type deduced from Triangle_mesh using Kernel_traits) as value type.
must be a model of ReadablePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<Triangle_mesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and a unique integer as value type.
must be a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<Triangle_mesh>::vertex_descriptor as key type and a Boolean as value type.
a halfedge descriptor on the boundary of mesh.
an instantiation of the class VertexUVmap.
an instantiation of the class VertexIndexMap.
an instantiation of the class VertexParameterizedMap.

simplesect.para: mesh must be a triangular mesh.
The vertices must be indexed (vimap must be initialized).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point_3 &p0, const Point_3 &p1, const Point_3 &p2, Point_2 &z0, Point_2 &z1, Point_2 &z2) const
memberdef.name: project_triangle

memberdef.argsstring: (const Triangle_mesh &mesh, face_descriptor facet, UVmap uvmap, VertexIndexMap vimap, VertexParameterizedMap vpmap, const FreeVertexIndices &fvi, Matrix &A, Vector &B) const
memberdef.name: setup_triangle_relations

briefdescription.para: The class LSCM_parameterizer_3 implements the Least Squares Conformal Maps (LSCM) parameterization [8].

detaileddescription.para: This is a conformal parameterization, i.e. it attempts to preserve angles.

This is a free border parameterization. There is no need to map the border of the surface onto a convex polygon (only two pinned vertices are needed to ensure a unique solution), but a one-to-one mapping is not guaranteed.

parameterdescription.para: must be a model of FaceGraph.
is a strategy to parameterize the surface border and must be a model of Parameterizer_3. Default: Two_vertices_parameterizer_3<TriangleMesh_>

must be a model of SparseLinearAlgebraTraits_d. Note: We may use a symmetric definite positive solver because LSCM solves the system in the least squares sense. Default: If Eigen 3.1 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined, then an overload of Eigen_solver_traits is provided as default parameter: CGAL::Eigen_solver_traits<Eigen::SimplicialLDLT< Eigen::SparseMatrix<double>>>
